a low-tide period. Performances are categorized into sections for sub-optimal (green), optimal (blue), sub-lethal (orange) and lethal (red).
Colours correspond to the categories in
, and blank spaces correspond to water at high tide.
Frequency distribution of surface temperature across the six timestamps on 22 June 2017 shown in
C (fromleft to right at each panel). Panels describe variations in the peaks and shape at each timestamp. The
patterns of surface temperature distribution can be quantify through thermal roughness (RqT), where the higher RqT means higher distribution

of these approaches could be used to quantify, for example,

formance modelling can further be used to quantify areas
